verdict.summary: Kinesis shard throughput limit exceeded. Each shard supports 1 MB/s write and 2 MB/s read.

dead_ends.why_fails: Aggressive retries without backoff amplify the problem and cause more throttling

dead_ends.action: Use a single partition key for all records
dead_ends.why_fails: Single partition key sends all records to one shard, creating a hot shard that will always throttle

workarounds.action: Increase the number of shards or enable on-demand capacity mode
workarounds.how: aws kinesis update-shard-count --stream-name NAME --target-shard-count N --scaling-type UNIFORM_SCALING or switch to ON_DEMAND mode

workarounds.action: Distribute records across shards using random or high-cardinality partition keys
workarounds.how: Use UUID or composite keys as partition key to distribute records evenly across all shards

leads_to.condition: Kinesis throttling may cascade to other AWS API throttling

preceded_by.condition: General AWS API throttling limits the ability to manage Kinesis streams
